  • After reviewing that document, close that tab, and click Next Page below

• There are three types of sequences that we will study in this course
  • Lists - Collection of objects that can be addressed by the list name + an index (other languages call them arrays)
  • Tuples - Similar to a List, but this collection of objects cannot be changed. Tuples are immutable.
  • Strings - A very specific collection of objects that holds characters. String are very common in your code, but they are a collection just like a List or Tuple. Just like a List individual characters can be address by the name of the string + an index
• Learn to be careful about indexing the last item in a sequence (and not beyond)
• In this video we'll demonstrate different ways to loop over (iterate through) a sequence.

• Read this excerpt from a textbook by Horstmann and Necaise. I think that you will find it interesting. (clicking the link will open a pdf in a new tab).
